Description: Fragment of Attic red-figured pottery lid; possible remains of attachment of knob at upper break, with band of dots around; inside glazed black; outside, to right, part of female figure's chiton; to left, an uncertain object decorated with groups of dots.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit associates the piece with Alexandria 17064 (her 380). The iconography is enigmatic; two dilute lines running across the drapery seem intentional.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 108 no. 382 pl. 80)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2123)
